1.title: MovieShots for Oct. 7
1.plot: In this show, we reviewed "The Girl on the Train," "Our Little Sister," and "Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children." We also had interviews with Kate Hudson, Nate Parker and Gina Rodriguez.

2.title: MovieShots for Oct. 14
2.plot: This week, the "MovieShots" crew reviews "The Birth of a Nation" and Kevin Hart's "What Now?" We'll also have interviews with Ben Affleck from "The Accountant" and Victoria Greene, the director of the documentary "Forgotten Bayou."

3.title: MovieShots for Oct. 21
3.plot: This week, the "MovieShots" crew reviews "Jack Reacher: Never Go Back," "Ouija: Origin of Evil," and "American Honey." Christin also talks to Tom Cruise and Cobie Smulders on the Red Carpet of the "Jack Reacher" premiere screening in New Orleans. Plus, check out our Top 5 Most Fun Scary Movies, meet our new reviewer Vanessa Rivas, and learn how you can win two passes to see "Almost Christmas."

4.title: MovieShots for Oct. 28
4.plot: This week, the "MovieShots" crew reviews "Inferno," "Tyler Perry's Boo. A Madea Halloween," and "Denial." They'll also give you their Top 5 Best Horror films EVER. Plus, learn how you can win two passes to see "Almost Christmas at the AMC Mall of Louisiana on Nov. 7.

5.title: MovieShots for Nov. 4
5.plot: This week, John Wirt is back from vacation just in time to help review "Moonlight" and "Trolls." George Spears, the newest addition to the team, interviews Mel Gibson on the Red Carpet of the "Hacksaw Ridge" premiere in New Orleans and Christin Rankins debuts her newest short film, "Me, Mom, Dad." Also, Vanessa Rivas introduces the show's newest segment, Must-See Movies, featuring "To Kill a Mockingbird."

6.title: MovieShots for Nov. 11
6.plot: This week on "MovieShots," the crew checks out "Dr. Strange," "Almost Christmas," "Scarface" and much more.

7.title: MovieShots for Dec. 02
7.plot: This week on "MovieShots," the crew checks out "Allied," "Bad Santa 2" and much more.

8.title: MovieShots for Dec. 09, 2016
8.plot: This week on "MovieShots," the crew looks at "Nocturnal Animals," "Manchester by the Sea" and "Sin Nombre."

9.title: MovieShots for Dec. 23, 2016
9.plot: This week on "MovieShots," the crew checks out "La La Land," "A Christmas Carol" and "Sing."

10.title: MovieShots for Jan. 06, 2017
10.plot: This week on "MovieShots," the crew checks out "The BFG," "Indiana Jones: Temple of Doom," and "Hidden Figures."

11.title: MovieShots for Jan. 27, 2017
11.plot: This week on "MovieShots," the crew checks out "Lion" and picks their Top 5 Movies to look forward to this Spring.

12.title: MovieShots for March 4, 2017
12.plot: Today on MovieShots, we'll be giving you the lowdown on the newest, bloodiest Wolverine movie to date. Will the R-rating be too much for audiences or will an 11-year-old who can remove a spleen with a pair of pointy claws be just what the doctor ordered? We'll answer this question and more with the best hosts two passes to the cinema and a cheap drink at a juke joint can buy, John Wirt and Christin Rankins.

13.title: MovieShots for March 11, 2017
13.plot: This week on "MovieShots," we'll be checking out "The Shack." Does this movie feel like a Twilight Zone episode gone awry or will the very sight of it change your life? Also, the biggest gorilla in the room is back with a new origin story. Will "Kong: Skull Island" be enough to reignite the ape franchise or is it just another giant flop? We'll answer these scathing questions and more with the best hosts three passes to the cinema and a cheap drink at a juke joint can buy, John Wirt, Christin Rankins and Vanessa Rivas.

14.title: MovieShots for April 01, 2017
14.plot: This week on "MovieShots," the crew will be taking a look at "Get Out," "Desierto," and the best upcoming movies before the big summer blockbusters.

15.title: MovieShots for April 08, 2017
15.plot: This week on "MovieShots," we'll be giving you the lowdown on the newest, sci-fi movie to hit the box office. Is "Life" really good? Also, the Smurfs are once again skipping their way into theaters. Could their new animated feature, "Smurfs: The Lost Village" be their best adventure to date? And finally, Woody Harrelson is back with his new film, "Wilson." Is his latest offering an eccentric and quirky comedy or one of the most annoying movies ever made? We'll answer these scathing questions and more with the best hosts two passes to the cinema and a cheap drink at a ...

16.title: MovieShots for April 22, 2017
16.plot: This week on 'MovieShots,' Chris Evans is back with his new film, "Gifted." Will his newest offering leave audiences in tears for all the wrong reasons? We'll also tell you all about the Lost City of Z. Is this movie really 2 hours and 20 minutes of map-making goodness? And finally, another "Fast and Furious" has plowed its way into theaters. Could "The Fate of the Furious" be the best of the franchise? We'll answer these questions and more with the best hosts two passes to the cinema and a cheap drink at a juke joint can buy, John Wirt and Christin Rankins.

-1.title: MovieShots for Nov. 18
-1.plot: Here's 28 minutes and 30 seconds of pure enlightenment as the "MovieShots" crew reviews, "Bleed for This" and "Arrival." They also give you their Top 5 Sci-fi Movies That Deserve a Little More Love, and tell you all about their Must-See Movie of the Week, "Pump." Oh, and did we mention that we also have J.K. Rowling and Eddie Redmayne on the show to talk about their new film, "Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them?" All that and more on this week's "MovieShots!"
